column4: Could anyone tell me a command of the «CD/DVD» creator application launcher?
Accidentaly deleted it.
brasero?
No.
Look at the «Edit menu» thing, they are different application.
Applications, I meant.
oh right, w8
It's all due to this https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alacarte/+bug/118936 bug, which is not fixed for some three years.
the command is:  nautilus --no-default-window --no-desktop burn:///
Please recheck, it gives me an error.
hmm, it works here. try leaving a space after burn:///
I though that ":///" part is some weird smile. :)
lol
Now you why that "wrapping" near commands is neccessary sometimes. :)
Thank you, it works.
in most cases to wrap filenames. instead of giving for example: command -i my\ file, you need the '\ ' to escape the spaces in the filename; an easier way is: command -i "my file"
I knew that. I meant wrapping in quotes in the chat, when communicating.
ah, for example, to separate your own text from the cmd you are giving to someone? for example: to list your files give "ls" in a terminal
I am not sure if this is correct, but I do so most of the time.
But in worst case you also need to mention not to type quotes in the terminal.
But luckily, it seldom happens.
yes, it's best to put it in a parenthesis at the end of your text, for example
